title: Expand GDD: Competition & Market Dynamics section content

requirements.summary: Expand the GDD template's "Competition & Market Dynamics" section to include detailed shared market mechanics, AI rival behavior patterns, ranking metrics definitions, auction-based wholesale contracts, and Cherry Festival event mechanics (English-only).
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/lib/gddTemplate.ts` section with `id: 'competition-mechanics'` includes dedicated subsections (or clearly labeled paragraphs) for: Shared Market Mechanics, AI Competitor Behavior Patterns (Traditionalist/Innovator/Businessman), Ranking System (Farm Value / Season Profit / Efficiency), Auction-based Wholesale Contracts, and Cherry Festival mechanics.
Ranking metrics explicitly mention Farm Value, Season Profit, and Efficiency and provide high-level calculation definitions in the section content (not just a list item).

Auction-based wholesale contracts are described as an auction system (not a fixed-price sale), including at minimum: when auctions occur, what is bid on, how winners are selected, and what obligations/rewards the contract creates.

Cherry Festival is explicitly named "Cherry Festival" (not only "Harvest Festival") and includes mechanics (timing, goals, rewards) and at least one stated interaction with market prices and/or rankings.
GDD rendering pages continue to display the updated section without layout/markdown rendering regressions (no broken formatting in the accordion view or Markdown export).

file_operations.description: Rewrite/expand the `competition-mechanics` section content to add clearly labeled subsections for: (1) Shared Market Mechanics (combined player+AI supply impacts retail/wholesale prices), (2) AI Competitor Behavior Patterns with detailed decision priorities and reactions for the three rival personalities (Traditionalist, Innovator, Businessman), (3) Ranking System definitions with high-level calculation descriptions for Farm Value, Season Profit, and Efficiency, (4) Auction-based wholesale contracts described as an auction system (timing, what is bid on, winner selection, contract duration/fulfillment, and effects on revenue/prices), and (5) Cherry Festival mechanics (timing, objectives, scoring, rewards, and at least one interaction with market prices and/or rankings). Ensure all user-facing text remains English and preserve existing Markdown-like formatting conventions so the accordion HTML rendering and Markdown export remain stable. Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
